dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Rural women are being completely left out of recovery programs across the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Rural women are being completely left out of recovery programs across the region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Regardless of their current level of detail, all of the regions recovery programs omit a key demographic: rural women. Unless governments quickly bring a gender perspective to their spending priorities, this large and vital group will be left behind, and the economic impact of official programs will fall short of their potential.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's a huge oversight, especially when you look at how hard rural economies have been hit—pandemic, economic downturn, climate change all at once.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's a huge oversight, especially when you look at how hard rural economies have been hit-pandemic, economic downturn, climate change all at once.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rural economies, which already had a weaker financial cushion and less access to public services than urban areas, have been besieged on three fronts: by the COVID-19 pandemic, the related economic downturn, and the relentless advance of climate change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and women in these areas have suffered more economically, with greater losses and mental health burdens too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and women in these areas have suffered more economically, with greater losses and mental health burdens too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, women have suffered more than men from the pandemics knock-on effects, incurring greater economic losses and mental-health burdens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The article mentions that in some places like Bangladesh, renewable energy isn't even accessible to women because it's deployed in male-dominated spaces like public markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The article mentions that in some places like Bangladesh, renewable energy isn't even accessible to women because it's deployed in male-dominated spaces like public markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In some countries, such as Bangladesh, women dont have access to renewable energy, because it is deployed in areas traditionally reserved for men, such as public markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so even when there's progress, it's not reaching everyone equally. But they suggest focusing on green jobs could be a game-changer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so even when there's progress, it's not reaching everyone equally. But they suggest focusing on green jobs could be a game-changer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key to fostering a post-pandemic recovery that benefits rural women is to create green jobs that can weather climate-change shocks and revitalize entrepreneurship in sectors like agriculture and energy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure—like Japan investing 43 billion in offshore wind farms. Renewable energy actually grew during the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure-like Japan investing forty three billion in offshore wind farms. Renewable energy actually grew during the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: South Korea, for example, recently announced that it will invest $43 billion to build offshore windfarms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And if governments directed some of that investment toward women-led small businesses, it could make a massive difference.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if governments directed some of that investment toward women-led small businesses, it could make a massive difference.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They also talk about digital literacy—women in low-income countries are 8% less likely to own a mobile phone, which limits their opportunities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They also talk about digital literacy-women in low-income countries are eight percent less likely to own a mobile phone, which limits their opportunities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Women in low and middle-income countries are 8% less likely than men to own a mobile phone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That digital gap is huge. But imagine if more women could engage with online energy markets—it could open up so many possibilities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That digital gap is huge. But imagine if more women could engage with online energy markets-it could open up so many possibilities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just good for equality; it's smart economics. More inclusive programs mean broader benefits for businesses and governments too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just good for equality; it's smart economics. More inclusive programs mean broader benefits for businesses and governments too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Gendered recovery packages would benefit both governments and businesses, and not only in Asia and the Pacific. Policymakers would foster inclusive economic development and demonstrate social and environmental stewardship, while firms would benefit from new markets and an increasing online population willing and able to pay for goods and services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like such a clear win-win—prioritizing gender in recovery spending helps everyone, not just women.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like such a clear win-win-prioritizing gender in recovery spending helps everyone, not just women.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Let's hope policymakers take note before it's too late.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Let's hope policymakers take note before it's too late.
